SUMMARY: AdiY is a positive DNA-binding transcriptional regulator that controls arginine decarboxylase (adi) system, which is strongly induced in rich medium, under anaerobic conditions, and at low pH [8704970, 7537138]. Several proteins are involved in induction of adi system. Changes in external pH activate adiA gene. AdiY may function directly or indirectly with CysB to increase expression of adiA. IHF and H-NS might modulate bending and necessary access of adiAp promoter for activation [8704970]. It has also been proposed that AdiY is not only regulator of adi system, but conditions under which AdiY functions remain unknown [12867448]. amino acid sequence of AdiY shows homology to members of XylS/AraC family of transcriptional regulators [8704970, 7537138]. C-terminal region of proteins from this family features a helix-turn-helix motif. AdiY has a putative transmembrane region, suggesting that it may be a membrane-associated protein [8704970]. gene adiY is located downstream of adiA and in same orientation [8704970]. lack of an evident transcription-termination structure in intergenic region between adiY and adiC, separated by 137 bp, suggests possibility of both genes being part of same operon [8704970] but furr studies have failed to confirm this [12867448].
